decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - This development has begun within 3 years from the date of the original permission ref. 2017/4726 dated 10/08/2018.
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings and specifications [C-1101 Rev D, C-1200 Rev B, C-1201 Rev B, C-1300 Rev B, C-1301 Rev B, C-2100 Rev P, C-2105 Rev M, C-2110 Rev L, C-2120 Rev L, C-2130 Rev K, C-2140 Rev K, C-2150 Rev F, C-2210 Rev H, C-2220 Rev K, C-2230 Rev H, C-2240 Rev G, C-2250 Rev H, C-2260 Rev H, 4178 C 0010 rev D, M19025/M/A/305 Rev F, Upper Tooting Road Energy Strategy Addendum dated June 2019 by Mendick Waring Limited, Upper Tooting Road BREEAM Pre-Assessment dated 26/11/2020 by Mendick Waring Limited], unless approved otherwise in writing by the local planning authority.  
To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Restoration Method Statement for the restoration of the retained fa�ade approved under details application ref. 2018/4966 dated 13/12/2018. The approved measures shall be carried out prior to the occupation of the Hotel Use hereby approved.
In accordance with the aims and objectives of Council Policy DMS2.

Condition : 4 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of those parts of the site not covered by building(s), including any parking areas, access ways, surface treatment and boundary treatment approved under details application ref. 2018/5866 dated 05/02/2019.
To ensure a high quality of development in compliance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 5 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the specifications of all external surfaces of the development [4178 C 0010 rev D] approved under application ref. 2020/2855.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved materials. 
In order to assess the suitability of the proposed materials, in the interests of the appearance of the locality, in accordance with Council policy DMS1. It is necessary for the condition to be discharged prior to the commencement of works to ensure suitable materials are used in the proposal.

Condition : 6 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of the scheme to insulate the approved residential units against noise generated by along Upper Tooting Road approved under details application ref. 2018/5868 dated 05/02/2019. The approved measures shall be installed prior to the commencement of the use of the building.
To protect the occupiers of the building(s), in accordance with Council policies DMH4(ii).

Condition : 7 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of landscaping and treatment of parts of the site not covered by buildings approved under details application ref. 2018/5957 dated 11/02/2019. All planting, seeding or turfing included in the approved details shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development, or in accordance with a programme agreed in writing with the local planning authority.  
To ensure a satisfactory appearance, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 8 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Tree Protection Plan and protection measures approved under details application ref. 2018/5957 dated 11/02/2019. 
REASON: To safeguard trees and hedges on the site in the interests of visual amenity and the character of the area, having regard to policy DMO5 (b) coupled with the requirements of paragraphs 17 and 109 of the National Planning Policy Framework 2012.

Condition : 9 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details of boundary treatment approved under details application ref. 2018/5870 dated 20/02/2019. Such details as may be approved shall be carried out prior to occupation of the buildings.  
To ensure a satisfactory appearance and to accord with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 10 - Details of noise insulation measures to provide effective resistance to the transmission of airborne and impact sound between the residential units on all floors and the directly abutting commercial tenancies (ground floor level) and hotel use (first, second and third floor levels) shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The approved measures shall be completed prior to the commencement of the use/occupation of the premises. 
To safeguard the amenities of adjoining occupiers, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 11 - Details of any external ventilation equipment, including ducting, shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the occupation of any of the retail units hereby approved for the purposes of a restaurant (A3).
In the interests of local amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 12 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the detailed design and construction method statements for all the ground floor structures, foundations and basements and for any other structures below ground level, including piling (temporary and permanent) in relation to Crossrail2, approved under details application ref. 2019/0592 dated 11/09/2019.
The development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the approved design and method statements.  All structures and works comprised within the development hereby permitted which are required by paragraphs C1(i), (ii) and (iii) and of this condition shall be completed, in their entirety, before any part of the building is occupied.

Condition : 13 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the detailed condition survey in relation to London Underground approved under details application ref. 2018/4056 dated 19/10/2018.
Reason: To ensure that the development does not impact on existing London Underground transport infrastructure, in accordance with London Plan 2015 Table 6.1 and 'Land for Industry and Transport' Supplementary Planning Guidance 2012.

Condition : 14 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the investigation into ground conditions undertook in accordance with the Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, Environment Agency, Contaminated Land Report 11 approved under details application ref. 2019/3370 dated 26/09/2019.
Reasons: To safeguard the public, the environment and surface and groundwater as this site may have or is known to have been used in the past for activities that are likely to have resulted in it being contaminated with material that is potentially harmful to humans, or the environment. It is necessary for this condition to prevent commencement.

Condition : 15 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the stage 1 and stage 2 written scheme of investigation (WSI) approved under details application ref. 2018/5957 dated 11/02/2019. 
Reason: To protect the historic environment in accordance with council policy DMS2.

Condition : 16 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Construction Phase Air Quality Assessment approved under details application ref. 2018/4624 dated 30/04/2019. 
Reason: To ensure that emissions are well controlled all planning consents for major development will include relevant planning conditions to reduce these impacts. To ensure that the amenities of occupiers are protected from the poor air quality in the vicinity in accordance with Policy DM04 of the Development Management Policies DPD (adopted September 2012), the Sustainable Design and Construction SPD (adopted April 2013) and Policy 5.3 of the London Plan 2011.

Condition : 17 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the method-statement for the reduction of emissions from construction vehicles approved under details application ref. 2018/5551 dated 16/01/2019. All mobile vehicles associated with the demolition / construction shall comply with the standard of the London low emission zone. All HDVs/HGVs should be Euro VI compliant for PM because of the intensive and extensive nature of construction in the surrounding area. 
Reason: To ensure that the amenities of occupiers are protected from the poor air quality in the vicinity in accordance with Policy DM04 of the Development Management Policies DPD (adopted September 2012), the Sustainable Design and Construction SPD (adopted April 2013) and Policy 5.3 of the London Plan 2011.

Condition : 19 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Air Quality Assessment (AQA) in line with London Air Quality and Planning Guidance and the Mayor of London Supplementary planning Guidance, and other best practice guidance approved under details application ref. 2018/6123 dated 19/08/2019.
Reason: To ensure that the amenities of occupiers are protected from the poor air quality in the vicinity in accordance with Policy DM04 of the Development Management Policies DPD (adopted September 2012), the Sustainable Design and Construction SPD (adopted April 2013) and Policy 5.3 of the London Plan 2011.

Condition : 20 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Air Quality Neutral (AQN) assessment approved under details application ref. 2021/1248 dated 29/09/2021.
Reason: This is designed to manage and prevent further deterioration of existing low quality air across London. The Mayor of London has published Supplementary Planning Guidance on Sustainable Design and Construction. This includes a requirement that new developments in London are air quality neutral. All major new developments, taken to be 10 or more dwellings or 1,000 sq metres or more floor space for all other developments, will have to calculate the building and transport emissions and compare these with a benchmark for development. The calculations cover the emissions of nitrogen oxides and PM10. The guidance also sets emission limits for boilers and centralised energy plant.

Condition : 21 - The development shall be built in accordance with the submitted Energy Assessment [Upper Tooting Road Energy Strategy Addendum dated June 2019 by Mendick Waring Limited] to include the following minimum reductions in CO2 emissions below the maximum threshold set in Building Regulations Part L 2013 when calculated using SAP10 carbon factors:
A) Residential use: 60%
B) Community use: 69%
C) Retail use: 34%
Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to accord with London Plan policy SI2 and Council policy DMS3 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 23 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the scheme of air pollution mitigation measures approved under details application ref. 2019/2991 dated 04/09/2019.
Reason: To ensure that the amenities of occupiers are protected from the poor air quality in the vicinity in accordance with Policy DM04 of the Development Management Policies DPD (adopted September 2012), the Sustainable Design and Construction SPD (adopted April 2013) and Policy 5.3 of the London Plan 2011.

Condition : 24 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details application ref. 2021/1376 dated 29/09/2021 which demonstrate that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved internal water use calculations.
Reason: In accordance with London Plan policy 5.15.

Condition : 25 - Prior to occupation, evidence (e.g. photographs, copies of installation contracts and as-built worksheets prepared under SAP or the National Calculation Method) should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority in writing.
Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to accord with London Plan policy SI2 and Council policy DMS3 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 26 - Within 3 months of work starting on site, unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM UK New Construction 2014 (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) Shell and Core Interim (Design Stage) Certificate for the Hotel, issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE), must be submitted, by the developer, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that a minimum 'Excellent' rating will be achieved.

Condition : 27 - Prior to commencement of the fit-out of the building, unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM Refurbishment and Fit-out 2014 Parts 3 and 4 Interim (Design Stage) Certificate for the Hotel, issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE), must be submitted, by the fit-out contractor, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that a minimum
'Excellent' rating will be achieved.
Reason: In accordance with London Plan policies 5.2 - 5.7; Wandsworth Core Strategy IS 2; and Wandsworth Development Management Policy DMS3.

Condition : 28 - Prior to first occupation of the building, unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM UK New Construction 2014 (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) Shell and Core Final (Post-Construction) Certificate for the Hotel, issued by the BRE, must be submitted, by the developer, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that an 'Excellent' rating has been achieved. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.
Reason: In accordance with London Plan policies 5.2 - 5.7; Wandsworth Core Strategy IS 2; and Wandsworth Development Management Policy DMS3

Condition : 29 - Within 3 months of first occupation, unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM Refurbishment and Fit-out 2014 Parts 3 and 4 Final (Post-Construction) Certificate for the Hotel, issued by the BRE, must be submitted, by the fit-out contractor, and approved in writing by the Local Planning
Authority to demonstrate that an 'Excellent' rating has been achieved. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.
Reason: In accordance with London Plan policies 5.2 - 5.7; Wandsworth Core Strategy IS 2; and Wandsworth Development Management Policy DMS3.

Condition : 30 - Within 3 months of work starting on site, unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM UK New Construction 2014 (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) Shell and Core Interim (Design Stage) Certificate for the Retail units, issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE), must be submitted, by the developer, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that a minimum 'Excellent' rating will be achieved.
Reason: In accordance with London Plan policies 5.2 - 5.7; Wandsworth Core Strategy IS 2; and Wandsworth Development Management Policy DMS3.

Condition : 31 - Prior to first occupation of the building, unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM UK New Construction 2014 (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) Shell and Core Final (Post-Construction) Certificate for the Retail units, issued by the BRE, must be submitted, by the developer, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that an
'Excellent' rating has been achieved. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.
Reason: In accordance with London Plan policies 5.2 - 5.7; Wandsworth Core Strategy IS 2; and Wandsworth Development Management Policy DMS3.

Condition : 32 - Prior to commencement of the fit-out of the building, unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM Refurbishment and Fit-out 2014 Parts 3 and 4 Interim (Design Stage) Certificate for the Retail units, issued by the Building Research Establishment (BRE), must be submitted, by the fitout contractor, and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that a minimum 'Excellent' rating will be achieved.
Reason: In accordance with London Plan policies 5.2 - 5.7; Wandsworth Core Strategy IS 2; and Wandsworth Development Management Policy DMS3.

Condition : 33 - Within 3 months of first occupation, unless otherwise agreed in writing, a BREEAM Refurbishment and Fit-out 2014 Parts 3 and 4 Final (Post-Construction) Certificate for the Retail units, issued by the BRE, must be submitted, by the fit-out contractor, and approved in writing by the Local
Planning Authority to demonstrate that an 'Excellent' rating has been achieved. All the measures integrated shall be retained for as long as the development is in existence.
Reason: In accordance with London Plan policies 5.2 - 5.7; Wandsworth Core Strategy IS 2; and Wandsworth Development Management Policy DMS3.

Condition : 34 - The parking areas shown on the approved plans, including cycle parking, shall be provided before the occupation of any part of the development, and shall be retained for parking purposes for the users of the development and for no other purpose. Works shall be carried out in accordance with approved details. 
To ensure adequate arrangements are made for off-street parking in accordance with Council Policy DMT2.

Condition : 35 - Except for the changes hereby approved, the development shall be carried out in accordance with the detailed shopfronts approved under details application ref. 2018/5871 dated 06/02/2019 (All units) and 2019/4094 15/11/2019 (Unit 3).
In accordance with the outcomes of Policy DMS1.

Condition : 36 - The ground floor retail Unit 5, as marked on the approved drawings, shall be used for A1-A4 uses only, and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class A of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987(as amended), or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).
To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood by ensuring that other uses which could cause a loss of amenity do not commence without prior approval.

Condition : 37 - The retail premises (classes A1, A2, A3, A4 & A5) shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of 0700 and 2300, and at no other times.
To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 38 - The ground floor unit 3, as marked on the approved drawings, shall be used for D1and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class D of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987(as amended), or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification). 
To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood by ensuring that other uses which could cause a loss of amenity do not commence without prior approval.

Condition : 39 - The D1/D2 unit shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of 0700 and 2300, and at no other times.
To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 40 - The third floor roof terrace shall be used for maintenance purposes only, and shall be off-limits to hotel guests. 
To protect the privacy of neighbours and prevent overlooking, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 41 - The flank facing windows to flats 1.5, 1.6 and 1.11, as marked on the approved drawings, shall be obscure-glazed, and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed and maintained as such in the future, unless approved otherwise by the local planning authority in writing.
To control overlooking, and safeguard the privacy of neighbours in accordance with Council policy DMS1(c).

Condition : 42 - No goods, equipment or other materials shall be stored or deposited in any open area of the site/premises. 
To protect the amenities and appearance of the area. in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 43 - No pipes or flues, other than rainwater pipes, shall be fixed on the front elevation of the building without the prior written approval of the local planning authority.
To safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 44 - Except for the aerial antenna hereby approved, and notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, or any future re-enactment of that Order, no satellite dishes, telecommunications masts or equipment or associated structures, shall be installed on the building without the prior written approval of the local planning authority. 
To protect the appearance of the building, and accord with Council policy DMS9.

Condition : 45 - Except for the roof plant hereby approved, no additional water tanks, plant, lift rooms or other structures shall be erected upon the roofs of the approved buildings without the written approval of the local planning authority.
To control the appearance of the building(s) and safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with Council policy DMS1.

Condition : 46 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework 2021 to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application.  The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act (as amended) for amendments of planning permission dated 01/01/2019 ref 2017/4726 (Demolition of the existing buildings, with the retention and restoration of the RACS building facade and redevelopment of the remainder of the site to provide a part single/part four/part five-storey building to provide up to 2,105sqm of flexible floorspace at ground level for retail, financial and professional services, restaurant, pub and bar (Classes A1-A4) and 173sqm floorspace for community use (Class D1/D2); a 96-bedroom hotel (Class C1); 41 residential units (comprising 9 x 1-bedroom, 29 x 2-bedroom and 3 x 3-bedroom units); associated car parking for 45 cars (including 29 spaces for public use), 124 cycle parking spaces, servicing areas and landscaping to allow alterations including omission of basement CHP, revision to car park layout, omission of PV's from roof level, amendments to roof plant, installation of telecommunication equipment on roof, alteration to rear facade window to Unit 3, omission of rear shopfront and addition of service door to Unit 4 rear facade, alterations to facade columns to Upper Tooting Road and Hebdon Road elevations, addition of small louvres to Hotel rear facade, revisions to parapet heights, revisions to cycle store elevations and revisions to elevations to sub station.
